classes.name: Client
classes.description: The starting point for making a Discord Bot.

props.name: rest
props.description: The REST manager of the client

props.name: dataManager
props.description: The data manager of the Client

props.name: manager
props.description: The manager of the Client

props.name: ws
props.description: The WebSocket Manager of the Client

props.name: resolver
props.description: The Data Resolver of the Client

props.name: actions
props.description: The Action Manager of the Client

props.name: voice
props.description: The Voice Manager of the Client

props.name: users
props.description: A Collection of the Client's stored users

props.name: guilds
props.description: A Collection of the Client's stored guilds

props.name: channels
props.description: A Collection of the Client's stored channels

props.name: token
props.description: The authorization token for the logged in user/bot.

props.name: user
props.description: The ClientUser representing the logged in Client

props.name: email
props.description: The email, if there is one, for the logged in Client

props.name: password
props.description: The password, if there is one, for the logged in Client

props.name: readyTime
props.description: The date at which the Client was regarded as being in the `READY` state.

props.name: voiceConnections

props.name: uptime
props.description: The uptime for the logged in Client.

methods.name: login
methods.description: Logs the client in. If successful, resolves with the account's token. <warn>If you're making a bot, it'smuch better to use a bot account rather than a user account.Bot accounts have higher rate limits and have access to some features user accounts don't have. User botsthat are making a lot of API requests can even be banned.</warn>
examples: // log the client in using a tokenconst token = 'my token';client.login(token);
// log the client in using email and passwordconst email = 'user@email.com';const password = 'supersecret123';client.login(email, password);

params.name: emailOrToken
params.description: The email or token used for the account. If it is an email, a password _must_ beprovided.

params.name: password
params.description: The password for the account, only needed if an email was provided.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Destroys the client and logs out.

methods.name: syncGuilds
methods.description: This shouldn't really be necessary to most developers as it is automatically invoked every 30 seconds, howeverif you wish to force a sync of Guild data, you can use this. Only applicable to user accounts.

params.name: guilds
params.description: An array of guilds to sync

methods.name: fetchUser
methods.description: Caches a user, or obtains it from the cache if it's already cached.If the user isn't already cached, it will only be obtainable by OAuth bot accounts.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the user to obtain

events.name: channelUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel is updated - e.g. name change, topic change.

events.name: guildUnavailable
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild becomes unavailable, likely due to a server outage.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that has become unavailable.

events.name: guildMemberRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a member leaves a guild, or is kicked.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the member has left.

params.name: member
params.description: The member that has left the guild.

events.name: guildRoleCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is created.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the role was created in.

events.name: guildRoleDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is deleted.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the role was deleted in.

events.name: guildRoleUpdated
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is updated.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the role was updated in.

events.name: guildUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild is updated - e.g. name change.

events.name: messageUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is updated - e.g. embed or content change.

events.name: userUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a detail of the logged in User changes - e.g. username.

params.name: oldClientUser
params.description: The client user before the update.

params.name: newClientUser
params.description: The client user after the update.

events.name: guildCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever the client joins a Guild.

events.name: channelCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a Channel is created.

events.name: channelDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a Channel is deleted.

events.name: channelPinsUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever the pins of a Channel are updated. Due to the nature of the WebSocket event, not much informationcan be provided easily here - you need to manually check the pins yourself.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that the pins update occured in

params.name: time
params.description: The time of the pins update

events.name: guildBanAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a member is banned from a guild.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the ban occurred in

events.name: guildBanRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a member is unbanned from a guild.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the unban occurred in

events.name: guildDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a Guild is deleted/left.

events.name: guildMembersChunk
events.description: Emitted whenever a chunk of Guild members is received

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the chunks relate to

events.name: message
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is created

events.name: messageDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is deleted

events.name: messageDeleteBulk
events.description: Emitted whenever messages are deleted in bulk

params.name: messages
params.description: The deleted messages, mapped by their ID

events.name: presenceUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a user changes one of their details or starts/stop playing a game

params.name: oldUser
params.description: The user before the presence update

params.name: newUser
params.description: The user after the presence update

events.name: guildMemberAvailable
events.description: Emitted whenever a member becomes available in a large Guild

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the member became available in

events.name: typingStart
events.description: Emitted whenever a user starts typing in a channel

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel the user started typing in

events.name: typingStop
events.description: Emitted whenever a user stops typing in a channel

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel the user stopped typing in

events.name: voiceStateUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a user changes voice state - e.g. joins/leaves a channel, mutes/unmutes.

params.name: oldMember
params.description: The member before the voice state update

params.name: newMember
params.description: The member after the voice state update

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted whenever the Client encounters a serious connection error

events.name: ready
events.description: Emitted when the Client becomes ready to start working

events.name: reconnecting
events.description: Emitted when the Client tries to reconnect after being disconnected

events.name: guildMemberAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a user joins a guild.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the user has joined

events.name: guildMemberUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a Guild Member changes - i.e. new role, removed role, nickname

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the update affects

events.name: guildMemberSpeaking
events.description: Emitted once a Guild Member starts/stops speaking

params.name: speaking
params.description: Whether or not the member is speaking

classes.name: ClientDataResolver
classes.description: The DataResolver identifies different objects and tries to resolve a specific piece of information from them, e.g.extracting a User from a Message object.

params.name: client
params.description: The client the resolver is for

methods.name: resolveUser
methods.description: Resolves a UserResolvable to a User object

methods.name: resolveGuild

methods.name: resolveGuildMember

params.name: guild

params.name: user
params.description: The user that is part of the guild

methods.name: resolveBase64
methods.description: Resolves a Base64Resolvable to a Base 64 image

params.name: data

methods.name: resolveChannel
methods.description: Resolves a ChannelResolvable to a Channel object

methods.name: resolvePermission

methods.name: resolveString

methods.name: resolveFile
methods.description: Resolves a FileResolvable to a Buffer

classes.name: ClientManager
classes.description: Manages the State and Background Tasks of the Client

props.name: client
props.description: The Client that instantiated this Manager

props.name: heartbeatInterval
props.description: The heartbeat interval, null if not yet set

methods.name: connectToWebSocket
methods.description: Connects the Client to the WebSocket

params.name: resolve
params.description: Function to run when connection is successful

params.name: reject
params.description: Function to run when connection fails

methods.name: setupKeepAlive
methods.description: Sets up a keep-alive interval to keep the Client's connection valid

params.name: time
params.description: The interval in milliseconds at which heartbeat packets should be sent

classes.name: RequestHandler
classes.description: A base class for different types of rate limiting handlers for the REST API.

props.name: restManager
props.description: The RESTManager that instantiated this RequestHandler

props.name: queue
props.description: A list of requests that have yet to be processed.

props.name: globalLimit
props.description: Whether or not the client is being rate limited on every endpoint.

methods.name: push
methods.description: Push a new API request into this bucket

params.name: request
params.description: The new request to push into the queue

methods.name: handle
methods.description: Attempts to get this RequestHandler to process its current queue

classes.name: SequentialRequestHandler
classes.description: Handles API Requests sequentially, i.e. we wait until the current request is finished before moving ontothe next. This plays a _lot_ nicer in terms of avoiding 429's when there is more than one session of the account,but it can be slower.

props.name: waiting
props.description: Whether this rate limiter is waiting for a response from a request

props.name: endpoint
props.description: The endpoint that this handler is handling

props.name: timeDifference
props.description: The time difference between Discord's Dates and the local computer's Dates. A positive number means the localcomputer's time is ahead of Discord's.

props.name: restManager
props.description: The RESTManager that instantiated this RequestHandler

props.name: queue
props.description: A list of requests that have yet to be processed.

props.name: globalLimit
props.description: Whether or not the client is being rate limited on every endpoint.

methods.name: execute
methods.description: Performs a request then resolves a promise to indicate its readiness for a new request

methods.name: push
methods.description: Push a new API request into this bucket

params.name: request
params.description: The new request to push into the queue

methods.name: handle
methods.description: Attempts to get this RequestHandler to process its current queue

classes.name: ClientVoiceManager
classes.description: Manages all the voice stuff for the Client

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this voice manager

props.name: connections
props.description: A collection mapping connection IDs to the Connection objects

props.name: pending
props.description: Pending connection attempts, maps Guild ID to VoiceChannel

methods.name: _checkPendingReady
methods.description: Checks whether a pending request can be processed

methods.name: _receivedVoiceServer
methods.description: Called when the Client receives information about this voice server update.

methods.name: _receivedVoiceStateUpdate
methods.description: Called when the Client receives information about the voice state update.

params.name: sessionID
params.description: The session id to authorise with

methods.name: _sendWSJoin
methods.description: Sends a request to the main gateway to join a voice channel

methods.name: joinChannel
methods.description: Sets up a request to join a voice channel

classes.name: StreamDispatcher
classes.description: The class that sends voice packet data to the voice connection.```js// obtained using:voiceChannel.join().then(connection => {  // you can play a file or a stream here:  connection.playFile('./file.mp3').then(dispatcher => {  });});```

props.name: volume
props.description: The volume of the stream, relative to the stream's input volume

methods.name: end
methods.description: Stops the current stream permanently and emits an `end` event.

methods.name: setVolume
methods.description: Sets the volume relative to the input stream - i.e. 1 is normal, 0.5 is half, 2 is double.

params.name: volume
params.description: The volume that you want to set

methods.name: setVolumeDecibels
methods.description: Set the volume in decibels

methods.name: setVolumeLogarithmic
methods.description: Set the volume so that a perceived value of 0.5 is half the perceived volume etc.

methods.name: pause
methods.description: Stops sending voice packets to the voice connection (stream may still progress however)

methods.name: resume
methods.description: Resumes sending voice packets to the voice connection (may be further on in the stream than when paused)

events.name: speaking
events.description: Emitted when the dispatcher starts/stops speaking

params.name: value
params.description: Whether or not the dispatcher is speaking

events.name: end
events.description: Emitted once the stream has ended. Attach a `once` listener to this.

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted once the stream has encountered an error. Attach a `once` listener to this. Also emits `end`.

events.name: debug
events.description: Emitted when the stream wants to give debug information.

classes.name: VoiceReceiver
classes.description: Receives voice data from a voice connection.```js// obtained using:voiceChannel.join().then(connection => { const receiver = connection.createReceiver();});```

props.name: connection
props.description: The VoiceConnection that instantiated this

methods.name: createOpusStream
methods.description: Creates a readable stream for a user that provides opus data while the user is speaking. When the userstops speaking, the stream is destroyed.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to create the stream for

methods.name: createPCMStream
methods.description: Creates a readable stream for a user that provides PCM data while the user is speaking. When the userstops speaking, the stream is destroyed. The stream is 16-bit signed stereo PCM at 48KHz.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to create the stream for

events.name: warn
events.description: Emitted whenever a voice packet cannot be decrypted

events.name: opus
events.description: Emitted whenever voice data is received from the voice connection. This is _always_ emitted (unlike PCM).

params.name: user
params.description: The user that is sending the buffer (is speaking)

events.name: pcm
events.description: Emits decoded voice data when it's received. For performance reasons, the decoding will onlyhappen if there is at least one `pcm` listener on this receiver.

params.name: user
params.description: The user that is sending the buffer (is speaking)

classes.name: VoiceConnection
classes.description: Represents a connection to a Voice Channel in Discord.```js// obtained using:voiceChannel.join().then(connection => {});```

props.name: manager
props.description: The voice manager of this connection

props.name: player
props.description: The player

props.name: endpoint
props.description: The endpoint of the connection

props.name: channel
props.description: The VoiceChannel for this connection

props.name: websocket
props.description: The WebSocket connection for this voice connection

props.name: ready
props.description: Whether or not the connection is ready

props.name: _resolve
props.description: The resolve function for the promise associated with creating this connection

props.name: _reject
props.description: The reject function for the promise associated with creating this connection

methods.name: _onError
methods.description: Executed whenever an error occurs with the UDP/WebSocket sub-client

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Disconnects the Client from the Voice Channel

methods.name: bindListeners
methods.description: Binds listeners to the WebSocket and UDP sub-clients

methods.name: playFile
methods.description: Play the given file in the voice connection
examples: // play files nativelyvoiceChannel.join() .then(connection => {   const dispatcher = connection.playFile('C:/Users/Discord/Desktop/music.mp3'); }) .catch(console.log);

methods.name: playStream
methods.description: Plays and converts an audio stream in the voice connection
examples: // play streams using ytdl-coreconst ytdl = require('ytdl-core');voiceChannel.join() .then(connection => {   const stream = ytdl('https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XAWgeLF9EVQ', {filter : 'audioonly'});   const dispatcher = connection.playStream(stream); }) .catch(console.log);

methods.name: playConvertedStream
methods.description: Plays a stream of 16-bit signed stereo PCM at 48KHz.

methods.name: createReceiver
methods.description: Creates a VoiceReceiver so you can start listening to voice data. It's recommended to only create one of these.

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted whenever the connection encounters a fatal error.

events.name: disconnected
events.description: Emit once the voice connection has disconnected.

events.name: ready
events.description: Emitted once the connection is ready (joining voice channels resolves when the connection is ready anyway)

events.name: speaking
events.description: Emitted whenever a user starts/stops speaking

params.name: user
params.description: The user that has started/stopped speaking

params.name: speaking
params.description: Whether or not the user is speaking

classes.name: WebSocketManager
classes.description: The WebSocket Manager of the Client

props.name: client
props.description: The Client that instantiated this WebSocketManager

props.name: packetManager
props.description: A WebSocket Packet manager, it handles all the messages

props.name: status
props.description: The status of the WebSocketManager, a type of Constants.Status. It defaults to IDLE.

props.name: sessionID
props.description: The session ID of the connection, null if not yet available.

props.name: sequence
props.description: The packet count of the client, null if not yet available.

props.name: gateway
props.description: The gateway address for this WebSocket connection, null if not yet available.

props.name: normalReady
props.description: Whether READY was emitted normally (all packets received) or not

props.name: ws
props.description: The WebSocket connection to the gateway

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Connects the client to a given gateway

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a packet to the gateway

params.name: data
params.description: An object that can be JSON stringified

params.name: force
params.description: Whether or not to send the packet immediately

methods.name: eventOpen
methods.description: Run whenever the gateway connections opens up

methods.name: _sendResume
methods.description: Sends a gateway resume packet, in cases of unexpected disconnections.

methods.name: _sendNewIdentify
methods.description: Sends a new identification packet, in cases of new connections or failed reconnections.

methods.name: eventClose
methods.description: Run whenever the connection to the gateway is closed, it will try to reconnect the client.

methods.name: eventMessage
methods.description: Run whenever a message is received from the WebSocket. Returns `true` if the messagewas handled properly.

methods.name: eventError
methods.description: Run whenever an error occurs with the WebSocket connection. Tries to reconnect

methods.name: checkIfReady
methods.description: Runs on new packets before `READY` to see if the Client is ready yet, if it is preparesthe `READY` event.

methods.name: tryReconnect
methods.description: Tries to reconnect the client, changing the status to Constants.Status.RECONNECTING.

classes.name: Shard
classes.description: Represents a Shard spawned by the ShardingManager.

props.name: manager
props.description: The manager of the spawned shard

props.name: id
props.description: The shard id

props.name: process
props.description: The process of the shard

classes.name: ShardingManager
classes.description: This is a utility class that can be used to help you spawn shards of your Client. Each shard is completely separatefrom the other. The Shard Manager takes a path to a file and spawns it under the specified amount of shards safely.<warn>The Sharding Manager is still experimental</warn>

params.name: totalShards
params.description: the number of shards you would like to spawn

props.name: totalShards
props.description: The amount of shards that this manager is going to spawn

props.name: shards
props.description: A collection of shards that this manager has spawned.

classes.name: Channel
classes.description: Represents any Channel on Discord

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated the Channel

props.name: type
props.description: The type of the channel, either:* `dm` - a DM channel* `group` - a Group DM channel* `text` - a guild text channel* `voice` - a guild voice channel

props.name: id
props.description: The unique ID of the channel

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the channel
examples: // delete the channelchannel.delete() .then() // success .catch(console.log); // log error

classes.name: ClientUser
classes.description: Represents the logged in client's Discord User

props.name: verified
props.description: Whether or not this account has been verified

props.name: email
props.description: The email of this account

props.name: username
props.description: The username of the User

props.name: id
props.description: The ID of the User

props.name: discriminator
props.description: A discriminator based on username for the User

props.name: avatar
props.description: The ID of the user's avatar

props.name: bot
props.description: Whether or not the User is a Bot.

props.name: status
props.description: The status of the user:* **`online`** - user is online* **`offline`** - user is offline* **`idle`** - user is AFK

props.name: game
props.description: The game that the user is playing, `null` if they aren't playing a game.

props.name: avatarURL
props.description: A link to the user's avatar (if they have one, otherwise null)

methods.name: setUsername
methods.description: Set the username of the logged in Client.<info>Changing usernames in Discord is heavily rate limited, with only 2 requestsevery hour. Use this sparingly!</info>
examples: // set usernameclient.user.setUsername('discordjs') .then(user => console.log(`My new username is ${user.username}`)) .catch(console.log);

methods.name: setEmail
methods.description: If this user is a "self bot" or logged in using a normal user's details (which should be avoided), you can set theemail here.
examples: // set emailclient.user.setEmail('bob@gmail.com') .then(user => console.log(`My new email is ${user.email}`)) .catch(console.log);

methods.name: setPassword
methods.description: If this user is a "self bot" or logged in using a normal user's details (which should be avoided), you can set thepassword here.
examples: // set passwordclient.user.setPassword('password') .then(user => console.log('New password set!')) .catch(console.log);

methods.name: setAvatar
methods.description: Set the avatar of the logged in Client.
examples: // set avatarclient.user.setAvatar(fs.readFileSync('./avatar.png')) .then(user => console.log(`New avatar set!`)) .catch(console.log);

methods.name: setStatus
methods.description: Set the status and playing game of the logged in client.
examples: // set statusclient.user.setStatus('status', 'game') .then(user => console.log('Changed status!')) .catch(console.log);

params.name: game
params.description: The game that is being played

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the User's mention instead of the User object.
examples: // logs: Hello from <@123456789>!console.log(`Hello from ${user}!`);

methods.name: deleteDM
methods.description: Deletes a DM Channel (if one exists) between the Client and the User. Resolves with the Channel if successful.

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Checks if the user is equal to another. It compares username, ID, discriminator, status and the game being played.It is recommended to compare equality by using `user.id === user2.id` unless you want to compare all properties.

methods.name: sendMessage
methods.description: Send a message to this channel
examples: // send a messagechannel.sendMessage('hello!') .then(message => console.log(`Sent message: ${message.content}`)) .catch(console.log);

methods.name: sendTTSMessage
methods.description: Send a text-to-speech message to this channel
examples: // send a TTS messagechannel.sendTTSMessage('hello!') .then(message => console.log(`Sent tts message: ${message.content}`)) .catch(console.log);

methods.name: sendFile
methods.description: Send a file to this channel

params.name: fileName
params.description: The name and extension of the file

classes.name: DMChannel
classes.description: Represents a Direct Message Channel between two users.

props.name: recipient
props.description: The recipient on the other end of the DM

props.name: lastMessageID
props.description: The ID of the last sent message, if available

props.name: messages
props.description: A Collection containing the messages sent to this channel.

props.name: typing
props.description: Whether or not the typing indicator is being shown in the channel.

props.name: typingCount
props.description: Number of times `startTyping` has been called.

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated the Channel

props.name: type
props.description: The type of the channel, either:* `dm` - a DM channel* `group` - a Group DM channel* `text` - a guild text channel* `voice` - a guild voice channel

props.name: id
props.description: The unique ID of the channel

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the recipient's mention instead of theDM channel object.

methods.name: bulkDelete
methods.description: Bulk delete a given Collection or Array of messages in one go. Returns the deleted messages after.

methods.name: sendMessage
methods.description: Send a message to this channel
examples: // send a messagechannel.sendMessage('hello!') .then(message => console.log(`Sent message: ${message.content}`)) .catch(console.log);

methods.name: sendTTSMessage
methods.description: Send a text-to-speech message to this channel
examples: // send a TTS messagechannel.sendTTSMessage('hello!') .then(message => console.log(`Sent tts message: ${message.content}`)) .catch(console.log);

methods.name: sendFile
methods.description: Send a file to this channel

params.name: fileName
params.description: The name and extension of the file

methods.name: fetchMessages
methods.description: Gets the past messages sent in this channel. Resolves with a Collection mapping message ID's to Message objects.
examples: // get messageschannel.fetchMessages({limit: 10}) .then(messages => console.log(`Received ${messages.size} messages`)) .catch(console.log);

params.name: options
params.description: The query parameters to pass in

methods.name: startTyping
methods.description: Starts a typing indicator in the channel.
examples: // start typing in a channelchannel.startTyping();

params.name: count
params.description: The number of times startTyping should be considered to have been called

methods.name: stopTyping
methods.description: Stops the typing indicator in the channel.The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().<info>It can take a few seconds for the Client User to stop typing.</info>
examples: // stop typing in a channelchannel.stopTyping();
// force typing to fully stop in a channelchannel.stopTyping(true);

params.name: force
params.description: Whether or not to reset the call count and force the indicator to stop

methods.name: createCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector
examples: // create a message collectorconst collector = channel.createCollector( m => m.content.includes('discord'), { time: 15000 });collector.on('message', m => console.log(`Collected ${m.content}`));collector.on('end', collected => console.log(`Collected ${collected.size} items`));

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter to create the collector with

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description: Similar to createCollector but in Promise form. Resolves with a Collection of messages that pass the specifiedfilter.
examples: // await !vote messagesconst filter = m => m.content.startsWith('!vote');// errors: ['time'] treats ending because of the time limit as an errorchannel.awaitMessages(filter, { max: 4, time: 60000, errors: ['time'] }) .then(collected => console.log(collected.size)) .catch(collected => console.log(`After a minute, only ${collected.size} out of 4 voted.`));

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: fetchPinnedMessages

methods.description: Gets the past messages sent in this channel. Resolves with a Collection mapping message ID's to Message objects.
examples: // get messageschannel.fetchMessages({limit: 10}) .then(messages => console.log(`Received ${messages.size} messages`)) .catch(console.log);

params.name: options

methods.description: Starts a typing indicator in the channel.
examples: // start typing in a channelchannel.startTyping();

methods.name: stopTyping
methods.description: Stops the typing indicator in the channel.The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().<info>It can take a few seconds for the Client User to stop typing.</info>

// force typing to fully stop in a channelchannel.stopTyping(true);

params.name: force

methods.name: createCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector
examples: // create a message collectorconst collector = channel.createCollector( m => m.content.includes('discord'), { time: 15000 });collector.on('message', m => console.log(`Collected ${m.content}`));collector.on('end', collected => console.log(`Collected ${collected.size} items`));

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter to create the collector with

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description: Similar to createCollector but in Promise form. Resolves with a Collection of messages that pass the specifiedfilter.
examples: // await !vote messagesconst filter = m => m.content.startsWith('!vote');// errors: ['time'] treats ending because of the time limit as an errorchannel.awaitMessages(filter, { max: 4, time: 60000, errors: ['time'] }) .then(collected => console.log(collected.size)) .catch(collected => console.log(`After a minute, only ${collected.size} out of 4 voted.`));

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

props.name: icon

props.description: The owner of the Guild

methods.name: toString

examples: // logs: Hello from My Guild!console.log(`Hello from ${guild}!`);
// logs: Hello from My Guild!console.log(`Hello from ' + guild + '!');

methods.description: Returns the GuildMember form of a User object, if the User is present in the guild.
examples: // get the guild member of a userconst member = guild.member(message.author);

params.name: user
params.description: The user that you want to obtain the GuildMember of

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Whether this Guild equals another Guild. It compares all properties, so for most operationsit is advisable to just compare `guild.id === guild2.id` as it is much faster and is oftenwhat most users need.

methods.name: setup
methods.description: Sets up the Guild

params.name: data
params.description: The raw data of the guild

methods.name: createChannel
methods.description: Creates a new Channel in the Guild.
examples: // create a new text channelguild.createChannel('new general', 'text') .then(channel => console.log(`Created new channel ${channel}`)) .catch(console.log);

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the new channel

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the new channel, either `text` or `voice`

methods.name: createRole
methods.description: Creates a new role in the guild, as of now this is just a blank role.
examples: // create a new roleguild.createRole() .then(role => console.log(`Created role ${role}`)) .catch(console.log);

methods.name: leave
methods.description: Causes the Client to leave the guild.
examples: // leave a guildguild.leave() .then(g => console.log(`Left the guild ${g}`)) .catch(console.log);

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Causes the Client to delete the guild.
examples: // delete a guildguild.delete() .then(g => console.log(`Deleted the guild ${g}`)) .catch(console.log);

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Updates the Guild with new information - e.g. a new name.
examples: // set the guild name and regionguild.edit({ name: 'Discord Guild', region: 'london',}).then(updated => console.log(`New guild name ${updated.name} in region ${updated.region}`)).catch(console.log);

params.name: data
params.description: The data to update the guild with

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Edit the name of the Guild.
examples: // edit the guild nameguild.setName('Discord Guild') .then(updated => console.log(`Updated guild name to ${guild.name}`)) .catch(console.log);

params.name: name
params.description: The new name of the Guild

methods.name: setRegion
methods.description: Edit the region of the Guild.
examples: // edit the guild regionguild.setRegion('london') .then(updated => console.log(`Updated guild region to ${guild.region}`)) .catch(console.log);

params.name: region
params.description: The new region of the guild.

methods.name: setVerificationLevel
methods.description: Edit the verification level of the Guild.

params.name: verificationLevel

params.name: afkTimeout
params.description: The time in seconds that a user must be idle to be considered AFK

methods.name: setIcon

params.name: icon
params.description: The new icon of the guild

methods.name: setOwner
methods.description: Sets a new owner of the Guild.
examples: // edit the guild ownerguild.setOwner(guilds.members[0]) .then(updated => console.log(`Updated the guild owner to ${updated.owner.username}`)) .catch(console.log);

params.name: owner
params.description: The new owner of the Guild

params.name: splash
params.description: The new splash screen of the guild

methods.name: unban
methods.description: Unbans a member from the Guild
examples: // unban a memberguild.unban('123123123123') .then(user => console.log(`Unbanned ${user.username} from ${guild.name}`)) .catch(reject);

Thismethod allows you to see if there are differences in content, embeds, attachments, nonce and tts properties.

classes.name: Role
classes.description: Represents a Role on Discord

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild that the role belongs to

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated the role

props.name: id
props.description: The ID of the role (unique to the guild it is part of)

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the role

props.name: color
props.description: The base 10 color of the role

props.name: hoist
props.description: If true, users that are part of this role will appear in a separate category in the users list

props.name: position
props.description: The position of the role in the role manager

props.name: permissions
props.description: The evaluated permissions number

props.name: managed
props.description: Whether or not the role is managed by an external service

props.name: hexColor
props.description: The hexadecimal version of the role color, with a leading hashtag.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the role
examples: // delete a rolerole.delete() .then(r => console.log(`Deleted role ${r}`)) .catch(console.log);

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits the role
examples: // edit a rolerole.edit({name: 'new role'}) .then(r => console.log(`Edited role ${r}`)) .catch(console.log);

params.name: data
params.description: The new data for the role

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Set a new name for the role
examples: // set the name of the rolerole.setName('new role') .then(r => console.log(`Edited name of role ${r}`)) .catch(console.log);

params.name: name
params.description: The new name of the role

methods.name: setColor
methods.description: Set a new color for the role
examples: // set the color of a rolerole.setColor('#FF0000') .then(r => console.log(`Set color of role ${r}`)) .catch(console.log);

params.name: color
params.description: The new color for the role, either a hex string or a base 10 number

methods.name: setHoist
methods.description: Set whether or not the role should be hoisted
examples: // set the hoist of the rolerole.setHoist(true) .then(r => console.log(`Role hoisted: ${r.hoist}`)) .catch(console.log);

params.name: hoist
params.description: Whether or not to hoist the role

methods.name: setPosition
methods.description: Set the position of the role
examples: // set the position of the rolerole.setPosition(1) .then(r => console.log(`Role position: ${r.position}`)) .catch(console.log);

methods.name: setPermissions
methods.description: Set the permissions of the role
examples: // set the permissions of the rolerole.setPermissions(['KICK_MEMBERS', 'BAN_MEMBERS']) .then(r => console.log(`Role updated ${r}`)) .catch(console.log);

methods.name: serialize
methods.description: Get an object mapping permission names to whether or not the role enables that permission
examples: // print the serialized roleconsole.log(role.serialize());

methods.name: hasPermission
methods.description: Whether or not the role includes the given permission
examples: // see if a role can ban a memberif (role.hasPermission('BAN_MEMBERS')) {  console.log('This role can ban members');} else {  console.log('This role can\'t ban members');}

params.name: permission
params.description: The name of the permission to test

params.name: explicit
params.description: Whether to require the role to explicitly have the exact permission

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the Role mention rather than the Role object.

methods.description: Send a message to this channel

methods.name: sendTTSMessage
methods.description: Send a text-to-speech message to this channel
examples: // send a TTS messagechannel.sendTTSMessage('hello!') .then(message => console.log(`Sent tts message: ${message.content}`)) .catch(console.log);

methods.name: sendFile
methods.description: Send a file to this channel

params.name: fileName
params.description: The name and extension of the file

methods.name: fetchMessages
methods.description: Gets the past messages sent in this channel. Resolves with a Collection mapping message ID's to Message objects.
examples: // get messageschannel.fetchMessages({limit: 10}) .then(messages => console.log(`Received ${messages.size} messages`)) .catch(console.log);

params.name: options
params.description: The query parameters to pass in

methods.name: startTyping
methods.description: Starts a typing indicator in the channel.
examples: // start typing in a channelchannel.startTyping();

params.name: count
params.description: The number of times startTyping should be considered to have been called

methods.name: stopTyping
methods.description: Stops the typing indicator in the channel.The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().<info>It can take a few seconds for the Client User to stop typing.</info>
examples: // stop typing in a channelchannel.stopTyping();
// force typing to fully stop in a channelchannel.stopTyping(true);

params.name: force
params.description: Whether or not to reset the call count and force the indicator to stop

methods.name: createCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector
examples: // create a message collectorconst collector = channel.createCollector( m => m.content.includes('discord'), { time: 15000 });collector.on('message', m => console.log(`Collected ${m.content}`));collector.on('end', collected => console.log(`Collected ${collected.size} items`));

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter to create the collector with

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description: Similar to createCollector but in Promise form. Resolves with a Collection of messages that pass the specifiedfilter.
examples: // await !vote messagesconst filter = m => m.content.startsWith('!vote');// errors: ['time'] treats ending because of the time limit as an errorchannel.awaitMessages(filter, { max: 4, time: 60000, errors: ['time'] }) .then(collected => console.log(collected.size)) .catch(collected => console.log(`After a minute, only ${collected.size} out of 4 voted.`));

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: fetchPinnedMessages
methods.description: Fetches the pinned messages of this Channel and returns a Collection of them.

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Checks if this channel has the same type, topic, position, name, overwrites and ID as another channel.In most cases, a simple `channel.id === channel2.id` will do, and is much faster too.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel to compare this channel to

methods.name: permissionsFor
methods.description: Gets the overall set of permissions for a user in this channel, taking into account roles and permissionoverwrites.

params.name: member
params.description: The user that you want to obtain the overall permissions for

methods.name: overwritePermissions
methods.description: Overwrites the permissions for a user or role in this channel.
examples: // overwrite permissions for a message authormessage.channel.overwritePermissions(message.author, { SEND_MESSAGES: false}).then(() => console.log('Done!')).catch(console.log);

params.name: userOrRole
params.description: The user or role to update

methods.description: Set a new name for the Guild Channel
examples: // set a new channel namechannel.setName('not general') .then(newChannel => console.log(`Channel's new name is ${newChannel.name}`)) .catch(console.log);

params.name: name
params.description: The new name for the guild channel

methods.name: setPosition
methods.description: Set a new position for the Guild Channel
examples: // set a new channel positionchannel.setPosition(2) .then(newChannel => console.log(`Channel's new position is ${newChannel.position}`)) .catch(console.log);

params.name: position
params.description: The new position for the guild channel

methods.description: Set a new topic for the Guild Channel
examples: // set a new channel topicchannel.setTopic('needs more rate limiting') .then(newChannel => console.log(`Channel's new topic is ${newChannel.topic}`)) .catch(console.log);

// Outputs: Hello from #generalconsole.log('Hello from ' + channel);

methods.name: array
methods.description: Returns an ordered array of the values of this collection.
examples: // identical to:Array.from(collection.values());

methods.name: first
methods.description: Returns the first item in this collection.
examples: // identical to:Array.from(collection.values())[0];

methods.name: last
methods.description: Returns the last item in this collection. This is a relatively slow operation,since an array copy of the values must be made to find the last element.

methods.name: random
methods.description: Returns a random item from this collection. This is a relatively slow operation,since an array copy of the values must be made to find a random element.

methods.name: deleteAll
methods.description: If the items in this collection have a delete method (e.g. messages), invokethe delete method. Returns an array of promises

methods.name: findAll
methods.description: Returns an array of items where `item[key] === value` of the collection
examples: collection.getAll('username', 'Bob');

methods.name: find
methods.description: Returns a single item where `item[key] === value`
examples: collection.get('id', '123123...');

methods.name: exists
methods.description: Returns true if the collection has an item where `item[key] === value`
examples: if (collection.exists('id', '123123...')) { console.log('user here!');}

methods.name: filter
methods.description: Identical to[Array.filter()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/filter),but returns a Collection instead of an Array.

params.description: Function used to filter (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to set as this when filtering

methods.name: map
methods.description: Functionally identical shortcut to `collection.array().map(...)`.

params.name: callback
params.description: Function that produces an element of the new Array, taking three arguments

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Optional. Value to use as this when executing callback.

typedefs.name: UserResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that resolves to give a User object. This can be:* A User object* A User ID* A Message (resolves to the message author)* A Guild (owner of the guild)* A Guild Member

typedefs.name: GuildResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that resolves to give a Guild object. This can be:* A Guild object

typedefs.name: GuildMemberResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that resolves to give a GuildMember object. This can be:* A GuildMember object* A User object

typedefs.name: Base64Resolvable
typedefs.description: Data that resolves to give a Base64 string, typically for image uploading. This can be:* A Buffer* A Base64 string

typedefs.name: ChannelResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give a Channel. This can be:* An instance of a Channel* An ID of a Channel

typedefs.name: PermissionResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give a permission number. This can be:* A string* A permission number

typedefs.name: StringResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give a string. This can be:* A string* An Array (joined with a new line delimiter to give a string)* Any value

typedefs.name: FileResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give a Buffer. This can be:* A Buffer* The path to a local file* A URL

typedefs.name: PermissionOverwriteOptions
typedefs.description: An object mapping permission flags to `true` (enabled) or `false` (disabled)```js{ 'SEND_MESSAGES': true, 'ATTACH_FILES': false,}```

typedefs.name: InviteOptions
typedefs.description: Options given when creating a Guild Channel Invite:```js{ temporary: false, // whether the invite should kick users after 24hrs if they are not given a new role maxAge: 0, // the time in seconds the invite expires in maxUses: 0, // the maximum amount of uses for this invite}```

typedefs.name: MessageOptions
typedefs.description: Options that can be passed into sendMessage or sendTTSMessage:```js{  tts: false,  nonce: '',};```

typedefs.name: ChannelLogsQueryOptions
typedefs.description: The parameters to pass in when requesting previous messages from a channel. `around`, `before` and`after` are mutually exclusive. All the parameters are optional.```js{ limit: 30, // the message limit, defaults to 50 before: '123', // gets messages before the given message ID after: '123', // gets messages after the given message ID around: '123', // gets messages around the given message ID}```

typedefs.name: AwaitMessagesOptions
typedefs.description: An object containing the same properties as CollectorOptions, but a few more:```js{ errors: [], // an array of stop/end reasons that cause the promise to reject.}```

typedefs.name: CollectorFilterFunction
typedefs.description: A function that takes a Message object and a MessageCollector and returns a boolean.```jsfunction(message, collector) { if (message.content.includes('discord')) {   return true; // passed the filter test } return false; // failed the filter test}```

typedefs.name: CollectorOptions
typedefs.description: An object containing options used to configure a MessageCollector. All properties are optional.```js{ time: null, // time in milliseconds. If specified, the collector ends after this amount of time. max: null, // the maximum amount of messages to handle before ending.}```

typedefs.name: ClientOptions
typedefs.description: Options that can be passed to a client:```js{  ws: {    large_threshold: 250,    compress: true,    properties: {      $os: process ? process.platform : 'discord.js',      $browser: 'discord.js',      $device: 'discord.js',      $referrer: '',      $referring_domain: '',    },  },  protocol_version: 6,  max_message_cache: 200,  rest_ws_bridge_timeout: 5000,  api_request_method: 'sequential',  shard_id: 0,  shard_count: 0,  fetch_all_members: false,};```

general.name: Welcome
general.content: [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/hydrabolt/discord.js.svg)](https://travis-ci.org/hydrabolt/discord.js) [![Documentation Status](https://readthedocs.org/projects/discordjs/badge/?version=latest)](http://discordjs.readthedocs.org/en/latest/?badge=latest) [![NPM](https://nodei.co/npm/discord.js.png?downloads=true&stars=true)](https://nodei.co/npm/discord.js/) # Welcome! Welcome to the discord.js rewrite documentation. The rewrite has taken a lot of time, but it should be much more stable and performance-friendly than previous versions. ## Installation `npm i --save hydrabolt/discord.js#indev-rewrite`

general.name: Updating your code
general.content:
# About Version 9.0
The 9.0 rewrite takes a much more OOP approach than previous versions, which allows code to be much more manageable.
It's been rebuilt from the ground up and should be much more stable, fixing caching issues that affected
older versions and it also has support for new Discord Features, such as emojis.

## Upgrading your code
Version 9, while containing a number of breaking changes, does not require a lot of changes in the code logic.
It does, however, require changes in some of the method changes. This is because most of the methods have been
moved away from the <Client> class into other classes where they belong.

Here are a few examples of methods that has changed:

* `Client.sendMessage(channel, message)` ==> `TextChannel.sendMessage(message)`
  * `Client.sendMessage(user, message)` ==> `User.sendMessage(message)`
* `Client.updateMessage(message, "New content")` ==> `Message.edit("New Content")`
* `Client.getChannelLogs(channel, limit)` ==> `TextChannel.fetchMessages({options})`
* `Server.detailsOfUser(User)` ==> `Server.members.get(User).properties` (retrieving a member gives a GuildMember object)
* `Client.joinVoiceChannel(voicechannel)` => `VoiceChannel.join()`

A couple more important details:

* `Client.loginWithToken("token")` ==> `client.login("token")`
* `Client.servers.length` ==> `client.guilds.size` (all instances of `server` are now `guild`)

## Callbacks

Version 9.0 eschews callbacks in favour of Promises. This means all code relying on callbacks must be changed.

For example, the following code:

```js
bot.getChannelLogs(channel, 100, function(messages) {
  console.log(`${messages.length} messages found`);
});
```
